page.title: 03MORWELLHAM QUAY CENTRE (2)
page.content: Visitors go to {Morwellham}to see the old port.People in Victorian costume show them some of the jobs that used to be done there like barrel making and assaying the copper. The{George and Charlotte}copper mine is opened up to the public to show them what the local mines were like.You go in in a little train. There is a big water wheel which was rebuilt from the original moulds. There are museums,shops,a slide show, picnic areas and carriage rides.The horse-drawn carriages are 4 years old but based on the original designs. They have some farm buildings which contain old farm equipment.There are 9 shire horses and ducks,chickens,geese, rabbits,goats,sheep and calves. The{Ship Inn}dates from 1500 but most other buildings were put up between 1770 and 1860.
